text: the capabilities that AWS offers are
both more powerful more scalable less
expensive and also allow different
students to be isolated from one another
so that one student cannot crash all of
the services that another student is
using I'm Zack Ives I'm a professor of
computer and information science at the
University of Pennsylvania
AWS educate is Amazon's program for
exposing their cloud services to
academia and allowing us to take
advantage of them and also for providing
a portal where we can as academics share
our materials and benefit from the
materials of other academics as we build
coursework that curricula I really
started thinking seriously about
building large-scale courses with
substantial projects essentially my
first year as a professor at Penn so it
was great that AWS around that point in
time had started to make their web
service capabilities available to
academia and so we ended up designing
curricula to actually take advantage of
having 10 20 100 machines at every
student's disposal to do things like
build projects that take the theory of
web crawling and distributed systems and
actually go from the theory to an
implementation to a substantial project
where at the end they actually had a
sense of pride and understanding in how
these things really work and I think
what the cloud allows us to do is take
these theoretical concepts like
complexity and scale and unreliability
and failures and actually show them for
real right the students build something
real and they have to deal with those
complexities in a way that you couldn't
do with sort of toy projects or
individual things that didn't have lots
of computers at your disposal it really
changes your ability to offer
assignments homeworks projects that have
a large
component that really is realistic for
the first it really changes our ability
from just doing very limited scale
similar computer tech things to
something that really resembles the real
world and I think the students as they
come out of these courses they're so
much better prepared for the kinds of
tasks the kinds of intellectual
challenges that they're going to face in
the real world so in my opinion it
really is a transformative thing
[Music]
